[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The WCS Reporting System (WCS-RS) defines requirements for an IBM-compliant reporting platform ensuring usability, security, and efficiency.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: WCS-RS supports report generation, authentication, database integration, and IBM branding compliance.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: WCS-RS integrates with IBM W3 authentication, CCR databases, and reporting services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: WCS-RS provides a GUI-based reporting dashboard formatted for 800x600 resolution.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: WCS-RS runs on IBM workstations with Windows 10+ or cloud infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: WCS-RS utilizes REST APIs, BI tools like Power BI and Tableau, and SQL databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: WCS-RS optimizes high-volume queries for efficiency.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: WCS-RS ensures continuous availability with scheduled updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: WCS-RS supports international CCR data integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: WCS-RS links to authentication, reporting, and compliance monitoring.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: WCS-RS facilitates report generation, authentication, monitoring, and scheduled updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: WCS-RS is designed for CCR users, supervisors, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: WCS-RS requires IBM workstations, Windows OS, and W3 intranet access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: WCS-RS relies on IBM authentication, CCR database access, and weekly queries.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Point-and-Click UI: Interface operated using a mouse or keyboard.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall authenticate users via IBM W3 login.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect to WCS databases and CCR data sources.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall export reports in Excel (.xls, .xlsx) format.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall refresh data weekly via automated queries (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI, allowing 90% of users to generate reports on first use.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 90% of queries within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support modern screen resolutions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user roles, report templates, and query logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with IBM branding, displaying IBM and CCR logos.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall follow IBM security policies and prevent cookie-based logins.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure 95% uptime relative to IBM W3 availability.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Report generation, authentication, and security shall be tested.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, UI guides, and IBM branding policies.
[SEC] 5. References: IBM usability standards, W3 authentication, and WCS policies.
